definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: I ask as I splutter into a tissue.
sentences.chinese: 我一邊拿紙巾擤鼻涕一邊問他。

sentences.english: Blow on the nose and nose picking may be the direct cause of bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 用力擤鼻子和用手指挖鼻孔可能是鼻出血的直接原因。

sentences.english: Blowing your nose too hard can cause earache.
sentences.chinese: 擤鼻涕太用力會造成耳痛。

sentences.english: After blowing your nose, insert the tip of the nasal spray container into your nostril and spray it one or twice.
sentences.chinese: 擤盡鼻涕後將噴霧瓶的噴頭伸入鼻孔內，噴一到兩次。

sentences.english: Maybe later we can all go blow our noses on my wedding dress!''
sentences.chinese: 回頭我們就可以用我的婚紗擤鼻涕了咯？

sentences.english: Is when she blow her nose, Kleenex sticks to her face.
sentences.chinese: 當她擤鼻子的時候，紙巾粘到了臉上。

sentences.english: When I blow my nose, my ears squeak.
sentences.chinese: 當我擤鼻子時，耳朵有聲音。

sentences.english: A young Guangdong man was shown blowing his nose with a 100-yuan note.
sentences.chinese: 一位來自廣東的年輕小夥，擤鼻子就給100元大鈔。

sentences.english: It's impolite to pick your nose and play with your boogers .
sentences.chinese: 挖鼻孔和擤鼻涕是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: She wiped her eyes and blew her nose on a tissue.
sentences.chinese: 她用一張面巾紙擦眼睛，擤鼻子。

sentences.english: The minister took out his handkerchief and blew his nose sonorously.
sentences.chinese: 牧師掏出手絹，響亮地擤鼻涕。

sentences.english: Don't blow your nose or use a toothpick at the table.
sentences.chinese: 不要擤鼻涕或用牙籤剔牙。

sentences.english: Don't blow your nose on a napkin. Napkins are for dabbing your lips and only for that.
sentences.chinese: 千萬別用你餐巾擤鼻涕，那可只是爲了擦嘴巴準備的。

sentences.english: If you blow your nose in the evening, the paper turns black.
sentences.chinese: 晚上試着擤鼻涕，整張手紙都是黑色的。

sentences.english: Don't blow your nose or use the tooth pick at table.
sentences.chinese: 不要擤鼻涕或用牙籤剔牙。

definition: to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
